com.github.ss111

Class ConfigHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.ss111.ConfigHelper

  • public class ConfigHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    ConfigHelper is used to help with configuration files. It's main funtionality is the ability to parse Forge configuration files and store information about conflicting blocks/items.
    Author:
    SS111

    • Method Detail

      • populateMaps

        public static void populateMaps(java.lang.String path)
        Populates 3 MultiValueMaps with block/item information by parsing Forge configuration files. There will be a separate MultiValueMap for blocks, items, and unknown (IDs that may be block or items in an attempt to support non-supported configuration files).

        The keys of the map will be the item/block ID.

        The value(s) of the map will be ArrayLists. Each ArrayList will contain the name of the block/item, and the "pretty name" of the configuration file that the name came from.

        Parameters:
        path - the path to the configuration directory
        See Also:
        MultiValueMap, ArrayList, getPrettyName(String)

      • getPrettyName

        public static java.lang.String getPrettyName(java.lang.String input)
        Returns the "pretty name" of a configuration file combined with it's absolute path. For example, calling this method on "C:\Users\Test\AppData\Roaming\.minecraft\config\test.cfg" will return "test.cfg".
        Parameters:
        input - the input path
        Returns:
        String
        See Also:
        ConfigHelper
